byline.contributor: Apostolis Fotiadis contributed reporting from Athens; Jim Yardley from Idomeni, Greece; and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.

abstract: Closing of Europe's main migrant route to Germany comes as welcome opportunity for human smugglers, who prey on more than 40,000 migrants and refugees stranded in Greece; approval of European Union deal to further stem flow could leave hundreds of thousands more stranded in Turkey; mounting desperation allows smugglers to demand thousands of Euros for passage and fake documents.

headline.print_headline: Smugglers Sense Opportunity as Borders Shut
headline.main: Smugglers Prey on Migrants Desperate to Find Back Doors to Europe

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

snippet: With migrants starting to grow desperate, smugglers are fanning out in Greece, promising help and stoking European concerns about alternate routes.
lead_paragraph: With migrants starting to grow desperate, smugglers are fanning out in Greece, promising help and stoking European concerns about alternate routes.
